Uses of Class
com.opitzconsulting.orcas.maven.BaseOrcasMojo

    • Uses of BaseOrcasMojo in com.opitzconsulting.orcas.maven

      Subclasses of BaseOrcasMojo in com.opitzconsulting.orcas.maven 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BaseOrcasOneTimeScripts 
      class  ExecuteOrcasOneTimeScripts
      Execute sql-scripts only once per schema.
      class  ExecuteOrcasScript
      Execute a single sql-script.
      class  ExecuteOrcasScripts
      Execute sql-scripts.
      class  OrcasCheckConnectionMojo
      Simple connection test.
      class  OrcasCleanLog
      Cleans the spoolfolder.
      class  OrcasCompileAllInvalid
      Compiles pl/sql code in the database.
      class  OrcasCompileAllInvalidIfReplaceablesExists
      Specialized version of compileAllInvalid which is only executed if replaceabels folder exists.
      class  OrcasDropReplaceables
      Drops all replaceanles in th database-schema.
      class  OrcasDropReplaceablesIfReplaceablesExists
      Specialized version of dropReplaceables which is only executed if replaceabels folder exists.
      class  OrcasExtractReplaceablesMojo
      Cretaes sql-scripts for replace objects existing in the database-schema.
      class  OrcasExtractStaticsMojo
      Cretaes orcas-scripts for existing static objects (tables, sequences...) in the database-schema.
      class  OrcasInitializeOrcasDb
      Installs orcas to the database if nedded.
      class  OrcasInstallReplaceables
      Exceutes sql-script that contain database-objects.
      class  OrcasOneTimeScriptsPostCompile
      Specialized version of ExecuteOneTimeScripts which is added at the end of the build cycle.
      class  OrcasOneTimeScriptsPreStatics
      Specialized version of ExecuteOneTimeScripts which is added at the beginning of the build cycle.
      class  OrcasSchemaSyncStatics
      This can be used to do a schema compare and to apply the changes to the destination schema.
      class  OrcasUpdateStatics
      This is the main mojo to update the database-schema according to the orcas-script files.
